required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Performance of a New Reduced Noise Mask Vent
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial of a New Mask Vent, Designed to Reduce Noise of Mask Venting

brief_summary.textblock: As continuous positive airway pressure is the treatment of choice for OSA, a mask is vital in ensuring the effectiveness of therapy delivery. The study will evaluate the performance and usability of the new mask vent. This is done by comparing the apnea-hypopnea index (AHI) of patients, who will apply 2 different washing procedures to the new mask, at the end of the study and their baseline data obtained at the beginning of the study.The study will also assess the breathing comfort as well as obtaining subjective data on the usability of the new mask vent system.

primary_outcome.measure: The apnoea/hypopnoea index (AHI) will be recorded and analysed.
primary_outcome.description: Breathing disruption events per hour of sleep will be measured and analysed

secondary_outcome.measure: The level of comfort patients experience while using the new mask vent
secondary_outcome.description: Patients will complete a questionnaire regarding the noise of the new vent

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's and bed partner's perceptions of the mask vent
secondary_outcome.description: Patients partners will complete a questionnaire regarding the noise of the mask vent

arm_group.description: This group will apply washing technique 1.
This group will apply washing technique 2.

intervention.description: A new vent CPAP mask system will be used in this trial.
A new vent CPAP mask system will be used in this trial

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are using ResMed mask
- Subjects willing to provide written informed consent
- Subjects who have been treated for OSA > 6 months
- Subjects who can read and comprehend English
- Subjects â‰¥ 18 years old
- Subjects who are using a ResMed S8 or S9 device
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are pregnant
- Patient on bi level treatment
- Patients being treated for OSA < 6 months
- Patients who have a pre-existing lung disease/condition that would predispose them to pneumothorax (for example: COPD; lung cancer, fibrosis of the lungs; recent (<2 years ago) case of pneumonia or lung infection; lung injury).
- Patients who are deemed unsuitable by the researcher due to the following reasons:
- They do not comprehend English
- They are unable to provide written informed consent
- They are physically unable to comply with the protocol

overall_official.affiliation: ResMed/ The University of New South Wales
